page.title: 20BLACKPOOL JUNIOR SCHOOL.
page.content: {Blackpool Junior School}is one of two junior schools in the parish of Ilsington.Built in 1879 it cost Â£350.5s.8d. with 101 pupils on roll. The building has changed very little, the old school bell is still used to start and end play times. With 2 extra classrooms 146 pupils now attend under Mr.Ashman,only the 15th head-teacher in 106 years.Apart from normal lessons the pupils study in their own 2 acre wooded conservation area and swim in the 12 year old P.T.A.built,heated, covered pool.They have yearly camps at Start Bay and Wemworthy and make an annual visit to London.Most children eat meals cooked in the school kitchens which also caters for 30 meals at Ilsington school.The pupils are divided into 3 houses,Fir,Ash and Oak,and work towards the school motto, "Only my best is good enough".
